intro: Couepia guianensis subsp. divaricata, commonly known as the Guianan couepia, is a climbing plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its twining stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain numerous seeds. It is often found in humid tropical forests, where it thrives in shaded, moist environments.
